page.title: 01KEISS VILLAGE AND AREA
page.content: This area is located on the north east coast of Caithness, on the shores of Sinclair Bay. The area comprises the village of Keiss, bounded to the north,west and south by flat farmland. The village of Keiss gets its name from the old Norse word 'keis' meaning "a rounded ridge". The village is 30m.above sea level while the highest point of the block is 60m. above sea level,and the lowest point is at sea level. Some 400 people live in the area The village harbour,built in the 1850's,is used for crab fishing, while the farmland is used for rearing sheep and cattle and growing winter feed. There is a rich historical tradition with 3 brochs and two castles in the block.
